Cartography1375 (Majorca, Spain)Abraham Cresques (1325-1387) <p>Catalan Atlas, an exquisitely beautiful visual cosmography, perpetual calendar, and thematic representation of the known world</p> Milestone Detail
Statistics & Graphics1450 (Italy)Nicolas of Cusa (1401-1464) <p>Graphs of distance vs. speed, presumably of the theoretical relation</p> Milestone Detail

Technology1545 (Leuven, Belgium)Regnier Gemma-Frisius (1508-1555) <p>The first published illustration of a camera obscura, used to record an eclipse of the sun, on January 24, 1544.</p> Milestone Detail

Statistics & Graphics1562 (Italy)Gerolamo Cardano (1501-1576) <p>Liber de Ludo Alaea, a practical guide to gambling, containing the first systematic computation of probabilities; written in 1562, but not published until 1663.</p> Milestone Detail
Cartography1569 (NA)Gerardus Mercator (1512-1594) <p>Invention of cylindrical projection for portraying the globe on maps, to preserve straightness of rhumb lines</p> Milestone Detail

Technology1581 (NA)Galileo Galilei (1564-1642) <p>Discovery of isosynchronous property of the pendulum (to be used for clocks and measurement)</p> Milestone Detail

Technology1610 (Italy)Galileo Galilei (1564-1642) <p>The first astronomical pictures ever printed, from observations through a telescope, used to illustrate discoveries of craters on the moon, the 4 staelites of Jupiter and a vast number of stars never seen by unaided eyes</p> Milestone Detail

Statistics & Graphics1614 (Edinburgh, Scotland)John Napier (1550-1617) <p>Invention of logarithms, and the first published tables of logarithms. <img src="file:///C:/DOCUME~1/default/LOCALS~1/Temp/moz-screenshot.png" alt="" /></p> Milestone Detail

Statistics & Graphics1617 (Leiden, Netherlands)Willebrord van Roijen Snell (1580-1626) <p>First use of Frisius' method of trigonometric triangulation to produce locations of major cities in Holland; foundation of geodesy</p> Milestone Detail

Technology1620 to 1628 (NA)William Oughtred (1574-1660) & Edmund Gunter (1581-1626) <p>Invention of a mechanical device, containing a logarithmic scale of equal parts and trigonomic functions which, with the aid of a pair of calipers, could be used as a slide rule. Technology1623 (NA)Wilhelm Schickard (1592-1635) <p>The first known adding machine, a mechanical calculator called the "Calculating Clock.'' Statistics & Graphics1626 (Italy)Christopher Scheiner (1575-1650) <p>Visual representations used to chart the changes in sunspots over time. Also, the first known use of the idea of "small multiples'' to show a series of images in a coherent display</p> Milestone Detail

Statistics & Graphics1632 (NA)Galileo Galilei (1564-1642) <p>Statistical analysis of observations on location of Tycho Brahe's star of 1572, based on idea that the most probable hypothesis is the one having the smallest (least absolute value) deviations</p> Milestone Detail

Statistics & Graphics1654 (France)Blaise Pascal (1623-1662) & Pierre de Fermat (1601-1665) <p>Initial statements of the theory of probability</p> Milestone Detail

Statistics & Graphics1657 (Netherlands)Christiaan Huygens (1629-1695) <p>First text on probability</p> Milestone Detail

Technology1663 (NA)Christopher Wren (1632-1723) <p>Automatic recording device (the weather clock) producing a moving graph of temperature and wind direction (in polar coordinates)</p> Milestone Detail

Statistics & Graphics1662 (England, UK)John Graunt (1620-1674) <p>Founding of demographic statistics: Development of the idea that vital statistics (records of christenings and burials in London) could be used to construct life tables. Statistics & Graphics1666 (Canada)Jean Talon (1626-1694) <p>First modern complete demographic census, a record of each individual by name of the 3215 inhabitants of New France</p> Milestone Detail

Statistics & Graphics1669 (Netherlands)Christiaan Huygens (1629-1695) <p>First graph of a continuous distribution function, a graph of Gaunt's life table, and a demonstration of how to find the median remaining lifetime for a person of given age</p> Milestone Detail
Statistics & Graphics1671 (Netherlands)Jan de Witt (1625-1672) <p>First attempt to determine scientifically what should be the purchase price of annuities, using mortality tables</p> Milestone Detail

Statistics & Graphics1686 (England, UK)Edmond Halley (1656-1742) <p>Bivariate plot of a theoretical curve derived from observations (barometric pressure vs. altitude), graphical analysis based on empirical data</p> Milestone Detail
Cartography1686 (England, UK)Edmond Halley (1656-1742) <p>First known weather map, showing prevailing winds on a geographical map of the Earth</p> Milestone Detail

Statistics & Graphics1687 (England, UK)William Petty (1623-1687) <p>Use of statistics for international comparisons, e.g., London vs. Rome and London vs. Paris, compared in people, housing, hospitals, etc.</p> Milestone Detail

Statistics & Graphics1693 (England, UK)Edmond Halley (1656-1742) <p>First real mortality tables, containing the ages at death of a stable sample of individuals under stable conditions (from Breslau Bills of Mortality)</p> Milestone Detail
Statistics & Graphics1693 (England, UK)Edmond Halley (1656-1742) <p>First use of areas of rectangles to display probabilities of independent binary events</p> Milestone Detail

Statistics & Graphics1712 (England, UK)Francis Hauksbee (1666-1713) <p>Literal line graph, inspired by observation of nature (section of hyperbola, formed by capillary action of colored water between two glass plates)</p> Milestone Detail
Statistics & Graphics1724 (Netherlands)Nicolaus Samuel Cruquius (1678-1754) <p>Abstract line graph (of barometric observations), not analyzed</p> Milestone Detail
